headline: Best Chocolate Frosting
description: This recipe makes the best chocolate frosting. Classic, simple, and decadent, this is the perfect topping to any cake, cupcake, or even cookie.
name: Best Chocolate Frosting

recipeInstructions.text: Stir melted butter and cocoa powder in a bowl until evenly mixed. Add in confectioners' sugar and milk; beating until smooth and easily spread. Stir in vanilla extract.

Perfect as is! Sweet and chocolaty and much better than anything you‚Äôd buy in a can. Some trouble shooting advice for others. If your icing turned out lumpy your butter was probably too cold. The recipe calls for melted butter yet many bakers use softened butter. I however like softening it in the microwave until soft and just the tiniest bit melty. Faster than letting it come to room temperature and still rich and creamy and perfect for spreading on cakes. No lumps either. When measuring by volume the actual amount of things like powdered sugar can vary a lot. It can be compacted our lightly packed or anywhere in between. So when adding milk do so VERY slowly. Just the tiniest bit too much milk will take you from perfection to soup. Once it‚Äôs no longer powdery I add milk just a few drops at a time. If it gets too loose just add more powdered sugar. To make black frosting I used this recipe and used an 1/8 cup (Two tablespoons) of wincrest black cocoa (this brand is jet black and perfect) and poured that 1/8 cup into a third cup and filled the rest up with regular cocoa powder and the other 1/3 cup I used regular cocoa powder. So the 2/3 cup cocoa called for in the recipe just roughly a third of that amount black cocoa. Then add a good bit of black paste food coloring and let sit over night. Don‚Äôt skip the wait as it takes the color from slate grey to actual black. Leave the frosting on the counter or in the fridge but let it come to room temp and stir well before using.
